website_summaries.verdict: A lightweight, compact design coupled with its stabilized 400mm-equivalent focal length zoom and affordable price make the Canon EF-S 55-250mm f4-5.6 IS a versatile lens for entry-level shooters and amateurs on a budget.
pros: optical image stabilization for sharper handheld photos at slow shutter speeds
cons: All-plastic construction, which is less durable than metal
sharpness falls off at 250mm where it is likely to see a lot of use

customer_reviews.title: 1st telephoto lens, happy learning
customer_reviews.text: This is my first telephoto lens and I am very happy that I get this one. I mainly use it to take pictures of backyard birds and it serves its purpose well. I'm usually 3-4 yards away from the subjects. While 250mm sometimes seems not enough to get what I want in an image it is still a very nice buy. I already know it's a 250mm, not a 400mm...so the rest of it comes to how the image shows when I take a picture.
customer_reviews.author: Yichen Chiang

customer_reviews.title: Nice lens
customer_reviews.text: Perfect. As described Canon EFS lens new in the box. I was debating between this lens, which has stabaliziaton (EFS) and the 300mm lense that doesn't (EF). While I would love a bit more zoom, the stabaliziaton is definitely necessary even at the 250mm zoom. For most photography purposes, this is enough. I like to photograph wildlife, and can fill the frame with a small animal like a bird from about 20 feet away at 250mm zoom. Excellent lens and I highly recommend, especially if you're between this and the 300mm zoom. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah H

customer_reviews.title: A good step up
customer_reviews.text: This is a good lens for those wanting to step up from an 18-55mm kit lens. It feels nice in hand and is easy to hold and switch out. The base is plastic, which isn't a big problem unless you're really throwing your camera around. I used this lens with an old Canon Digital Rebel (300D) and had no problems with it. The stabilization is great, but sometimes the focusing is a little slow. I haven't missed any shots because of it, and at last resort, you can put it in manual focus and go from there.
customer_reviews.author: ASHAPv2

customer_reviews.title: I love this lens!
customer_reviews.text: I attached pics of an old smokestack where I work. Both are as they were shot, no alterations. First at minimum (55mm) zoom, the second at max (250mm) zoom. I was able to crop even more detailed images from the second pic. As this is an IS lens, they were clear, even though both were handheld shots. Third is a cropped pic of the Moon, again a handheld shot. I'm kind of a noob, and can't compare it to other lenses from personal experience (except the Canon 18-55 kit lens that has it's own merits), but I love this thing. I don't see how you can go wrong with this lens, especially at this price ($125).
customer_reviews.author: rashhangover

customer_reviews.title: Great Lens for The Price!
customer_reviews.text: I’m a graphic designer and I don’t normally do photography jobs but I got offered to do one that I couldn’t refuse, which was for a football (soccer) team. I ordered this lens knowing I needed one with more zoom. It showed up quickly and in great condition. It worked so much better than I thought it would and the client loved the photos. For what started as an impulse buy is now a lens that is one of my favorites. The price is amazing and is perfect for beginners or one that is wanting to learn photography more seriously. I can’t wait to practice with this lens and work my way up to a lens with a bigger budget.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great lens with image stablization!
customer_reviews.text: Edited to add photos! Beyond happy with this lens - and ecstatic to have image stablization again! I had purchased a 75-300mm lens without it, so my shots weren't always the cleanest because I have a slight shake when I shoot. IS has saved this amateur photog's life! And on top of it all, the lens is clean and got to me lightning fast - a week ahead of what I was originally given, from Canada at that! Thanks so much!!
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: A thousand pictures later
customer_reviews.text: When I was thinking about visiting the Zoo, I was very curious to learn how much difference this new lens would perform. I am attaching two photos from the zoo using the maximum range of zoom in manual mode. The stabilizer works really well by assisting with any possible shake. The two images of the moon show their respective magnification image to illustrate the resolution of the image. I have taken many many pictures with great outcome. I am very happy with Canon for making good quality products at a competitive price.
customer_reviews.author: Alvaro A. Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Great Beginner Lens
customer_reviews.text: I really like this lens. It does a decent job with sports photography and handles low light conditions as best as it can. My initial tests of this lens were in an enclosed arena for a rodeo. Overall I was quite impressed with how everything turned out. I would love to be able to afford a faster lens, but when on a budget this lens works quite well. The only annoying thing about this lens is when you turn on image stabilization it has this clicking/buzzing sound from the lens. So, if you are doing video work, the microphone may pick up on this sound.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Heine

customer_reviews.title: It's a great lens for a great price
customer_reviews.text: For the price, you absolutely cannot go wrong. It's a great lens for a great price. This is a really good lens that is going for less because it has been replaced by a newer model. That's it. This lens was recommended to me by a couple of friends that have been using this one for a good couple of years now. This, at one time was an expensive lens. It beats out cold the cheap 75-300mm lens that comes with some of the kits. Now that is a cheap lens. There is no comparison. Again, for this type of lens, you can't beat it. This has the image stabilization and that makes a huge difference.
customer_reviews.author: Kitty

customer_reviews.title: Great lens for starting out
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this lens specifically for the image stability option. I love this and being able to take distance photos without needing to set up a tri-pod. I am just a beginner photographer, but for my purposes, this lens in great! I like to take photos of morning sky colors just before the sun comes up and this has allowed me to capture some great ones. I definitely recommend this lens for people just starting out. This lens also has auto focus. I have played with this a little bit and sometimes I use that option too, but more often I use the manual focus option. I just like being able to control it.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin

customer_reviews.title: using this canon lens on a fuji x-t3
customer_reviews.text: FUJI X-T3 camera FRINGER ADAPTER-$349 Fringer EF-FX Pro II Canon EF-S 55-250mm f/4.0-5.6 IS II Telephoto Zoom Lens. took all 3 items for it to work on the fuji-x-t3 i got the adapter for the 514.99 Tamron 18-400/3.5-6.3 Di II VC HLD> B028 which i just ordered it for the fuji x-t3. cant really rate the stablizer or auto focus because the adapter, if it was cannon camera to canon lens i could. click to inlarge picture
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lacks depth of field.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this lens 4 years ago and have always had problems with depth of field. Have played with all settings including aperture and still have crappy depth of field when zoomed in. I always thought it was me or something I wasn't doing, but recently had a much better photographer look at it and they came to the same conclusion. Now my question is: Is it just my lens that is possibly defective or are they all like this? I was using a tripod and photographing birds in my flowers and two birds not even 1 foot apart, one was in focus the other was blurry.
customer_reviews.author: Owyhee gal

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Value
customer_reviews.text: I got this for around $120 and have been loving the value of the product. It is said to be a tank, but I got 2 years of Canon CarePak+ for it for around $20. The autofocus and stabilization are great, especially at this price point. The auto focus is even a little more quiet than that of my kit lens. The images come out very clear. Overall I have been blown away by this lens!
customer_reviews.author: Chris I

customer_reviews.title: grainy pics under medium light
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a professional photographer but would expect much crisper pictures that perhaps my editing software could help with tweaks to make better. Unfortunately, I have yet to manage to get crisp pictures with this lens. Likely will return and try another in case something isn't quite right with this one. Then again, I'm not certain that my other lens is better, perhaps something wrong with my Rebel T6.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Light, Versatile and Great for Animal Photography
customer_reviews.text: This lens is excellent. Living in Florida, I love to go to the everglades and take pictures of wildlife. I laugh at all the hobbyists that have the $3000 telephoto lenses to take pictures of animals that are within 30 feet of them. This lens does the trick. Easy to auto-focus, great range and best of all, lightweight for the adventurous hiker/photographer who doesn't want to lug around a huge lens kit.
customer_reviews.author: sam

customer_reviews.title: Huge Upgrade From Kit Lens!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to take pictures of the moon, and wow! I am so impressed with the details of the craters! I'm just a hobbyist and am still learning but this lens definitely makes me want to see what the more expensive lenses are capable of. Next time I plan to test this lens out on wildlife! The camera that I use this with is a Canon Rebel t7. The picture of the moon I added is from April 2020. The picture of the Milky Way and Venus is from July 2020.
customer_reviews.author: Kari

customer_reviews.title: perfect for what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I had an 18-55 lens and a 75-300 that both came with my camera. I frequently found myself in a position where the 18 lens didn't zoom far enough for what I wanted and the 75 lens couldn't zoom out enough. I kept wasting time swapping lenses back and forth just to not be able to get the picture I wanted anyways, so this is great for getting right in that 55-75 sweet spot but also being able to zoom in pretty far.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary Rutherford

customer_reviews.title: Affordable super zoom lens
customer_reviews.text: Nice lens in good condition. I recently took a trip to Colorado and needed a better super zoom lens. This one does a good job. Gets quite far, but sometimes I need a little more. Those lenses are however quite expensive. For everyday use this one is quite good. Makes me realize I needed to replace my Canon Rebel camera as for close up photos my cell phone does better.
customer_reviews.author: awraynor

customer_reviews.title: Great zoom!
customer_reviews.text: I love this lens!! It's an awesome zoom! I consider myself intermediate level hobbyist, and I do photoshoots for people at no cost to give them family photos with better quality than mall studios. This lens is perfect for those who want the off-in-the-distance look in their photos, and I don't have to be ridiculously far to achieve it. It's also great for when I photograph landscapes like the wild bluebonnets out here in the Texas countryside. I do not have professional knowledge, so for pro's I would recommend looking in to reviews on canon's site... for hobbyists and those that are just looking for a decent zoom, this is a great option!
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: This lens has allowed me to capture closeup images of birds, which is what I bought it for. However, the images aren't all that sharp. You get what you pay for and this is an "affordable" lens. Don't expect professional quality images from it, though. For that you will pay much, much more.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Ward

customer_reviews.title: Better than new
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this lens "used", and it came a day before the estimated date of arrival. It was well packaged. The lens looked better than new (the price made it better than new). It takes awesome pictures. It's a kit lens, but works extremely well on my Canon 4000d. I highly recommend the seller and Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Roberta Hollingsworth

customer_reviews.title: One of my favorite lenses to use when birdwatching
customer_reviews.text: One of my favorite lenses to use when birdwatching. I am still a novice when it comes to photography, but I feel like this lens is a great start for getting photos of birds and other small animals that are difficult to get close to. It can capture amazing details as long as you have enough light. I have even captured some nice shots of the moon where you can see so many different craters and shadows.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for the price
customer_reviews.text: so for the money, solid choice, the zoom is good quality is good, low light performance is rough but that's to be expected. Good quality pictures but the AF is slow, scans for ever, etc. I still think if you are looking for a cheap lens, this one is a great value. If you don't mind spending time messing with the focus and needing good natural light, great lens.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Excellent lense for the price. Love the photos.
customer_reviews.text: Love this lense. New guy to the SLR style camera realm. Wanted for close ups of the daughter playing soccer. This steals the show. Concerts and school event phenomenal. Older two kids want to know why I didn’t have when they were younger. Read all the camera nerds reviews I did, the folks giving this 5 stars were right on the money.
customer_reviews.author: Buck

customer_reviews.title: Great lens for the price!
customer_reviews.text: For the money, this is a great lens. I'm an amateur nature photographer and this lens came in handy when I was whale watching this summer. Went with this lens over the 300 mm because of the image stabilization, which my shaky hands definitely need.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Goodson

customer_reviews.title: A good lens for the money
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my Canon EOS. Boy am I glad I did, I had only used the 35-55mm lens that the camera came with, and as an engineer with a background in optics I really wanted a longer lens. This fills the bill Technically, while I have not run an MTF on the lens, I can tell you the lens has very good color correction across the entire range, It has very low distortion and no noticeable vignetting. Overall and excellent value..
customer_reviews.author: Texican

customer_reviews.title: Very clear images
customer_reviews.text: I picked up this lens to replace my standard 300 mm zoom lens that came with the camera. This one is very impressive. Loved taking wildlife photos. The images are very clear. It is a noticeable improvement over the 300 mm lens.
customer_reviews.author: bookreviewer

customer_reviews.title: Canon EF-S 55-250mm best for amature birding
customer_reviews.text: I have a Canon T5 that came with 18-55mm and 75-300mm lenses. I found myself having to constantly change lenses depending on what shots I was taking. No telephoto ability with the lower powered lenses and missing close-ups with the higher powered lenses. The 55-250mm lenses was recommended for better all around shots unless all I was doing was taking close-ups or long range shots. Since I have put it on my camera I haven't had to change the lenses even once. It is great for the larger range of shots and the resolution makes up for the minor difference in the telephoto capability of the longer range lenses. Good choice for amature birding and nature shooting.
customer_reviews.author: TCJ

customer_reviews.title: ... my old memory cards I realized that I have better pictures with my 55-250 than my 75-300
customer_reviews.text: After looking through my old memory cards I realized that I have better pictures with my 55-250 than my 75-300. The 75-300 is very slow with my Canon Rebel T3 and the 250 is very fast. I use this lens to take hiking with me instead of my 18-55 or 300m. I compromise on landscape photos but will sacrifice that for telephoto capability in the event I see a mammal or hawk that I can capture much better with a 250

customer_reviews.title: Good lens great price for hobbyists
customer_reviews.text: New to photography. I pick up new hobbies at whim so I didn’t want to spend a small fortune on camera accessories immediately but knew I had a need for this type of lens. It is noisy but I’m ok with that. It took a little getting used to but it really seems to read my mind. I’m pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: dreamweaver

customer_reviews.title: Nice telephoto lens
customer_reviews.text: I bough this lens expecting to use it all the time. What I learnt was that this kind of lenses are of very specific use. However, the few pictures I take with it are of very high quality and the lens has survived through the years in very good shape.

customer_reviews.title: Great lense for beginners
customer_reviews.text: Dipping my toes back in to world of SLR and knew I'd need a longer lense than the kit lense that cake with my Rebel, so I bought this almost 6 months prior. For what it is, I feel it works as it should. Got it refurbished and it does everything I need it to as an amateur nature/wildlife photographer. If you're looking for an affordable telephoto for a cropped-sensor Canon, this is a great start.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is a fine mid-range, medium quality telephoto lens
customer_reviews.text: This is a fine mid-range, medium quality telephoto lens. Works well with my Canon EOS 40D camera. All the automatic features, including focus, work well. If you have an older Canon camera that doesn't need a lens with video support, this is a good choice. It's no longer being manufactured, however, so grab one while supplies last. The price on Amazon is about half what you will pay at B&H.
customer_reviews.author: WhiteDog

customer_reviews.title: First lens since my film camera days
customer_reviews.text: I assembled a camera outfit from discontinued products because I wanted to limit my expenses, start with one lens and buy new components. I am extremely pleased with this lens. It is very easy to use, lightweight and well constructed. The auto focus feature is faster than I expected and the manual zoom is smooth and fast. Manual focus is available at the flick of the switch and is easy to use. The stabilizer feature is switch selectable but I have left it on. This lens works well in available light conditions.
customer_reviews.author: Chocolate Fun

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for the money
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Bought it for my Canon 70D. I've used the stock lens for the longest. Yeah this lens is only 250mm but a lot better distance than my other. Reason I gave it 4 stars is because, yes it has a motorized AF when stock don't, but it is a little noisy when moving. Nothing bad. Not a reason to not bad. Im a perfectionist sometimes but very good lens for the money. Especially since it has IS on it. Recommend
customer_reviews.author: Josh Little

customer_reviews.title: Great service!
customer_reviews.text: I am just getting used to the functions of my new camera, but knew I was going to need a good telephoto lense to go with it. It fit perfectly and I am sure it will give me a chance to get wonderful shots. It came to me quickly and was well packaged against damage. I would use this vendor again.
customer_reviews.author: June M.

customer_reviews.title: Creative Control
customer_reviews.text: I got this lens as a package deal during the summer of 2011, along with the t3i. After using this, I find it hard to go back to the stock (18-55 mm) lens. I enjoy taking portraits and capturing facial expressions, and for that, this lens provides plenty of zoom and great bokeh at a low aperture setting. The only downside to the lens is the speed of auto focus. Also, the subject has to be at a considerable distance to ensure correct focus, but considering the zoom ratio, this is expected. All in all, great introductory lens for a beginner (like me) yielding professional results, at least, for portraiture.
customer_reviews.author: SudR

customer_reviews.title: I was able to get some great shots of her from far away
customer_reviews.text: I'm an amateur, and bought this for my sister's graduation. I was able to get some great shots of her from far away. I was in the stands--fourth row near one of the end zones where the stage was at--of the Centurylink Field Stadium in Seattle where the University of Washington held the commencement ceremony that year. And she was in the center of the football field (covered up so they could place seats for the graduates). Pictures turned out great. Too my amateur eye, anyway. However, don't even bother using it for video. Auto focus is way to slow for that.
customer_reviews.author: Mar

customer_reviews.title: Great and affordable zoom lens
customer_reviews.text: I love this lens. When i started shooting I often used the Zoom lens to make up for the difference in aperture from the lens kit i got. Of course I had to be twice as far from my subjects in order to create the effect I was looking for. Nonetheless this lens is a great starter lens to capture detail far away. It's also very affordable for it's capabilities. A reminder: Make sure to research if the lens is good for photography or film. The camera 70D has auto focus but most lenses are not good for film, they make too much noise and will ruin your fotage if you don't have different sound recording source.
customer_reviews.author: myMarcio

customer_reviews.title: Great Price, Great Lens
customer_reviews.text: I was initially hesitant on the 1)price and 2)some of the comments about the 'plastic' body. Maybe I'm too naive to know the difference, but upon receiving it, I disconnected my one lens and popped this one on and it felt and acted perfectly. I can't comment on the Image Stabilization (I wouldn't know how to actually test that) but the Auto focus was just fine. Smooth manual focusing, and my Canon D70 didn't complain a bit. Would definitely recommend this lens.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE this lens
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this lens. I've gotten so many cool shots from this lens on a canon rebel t3i. As a beginner, I have this and an 18-55mm, and that's all I need right now. I would recommend this to anyone looking to up their photo game.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very good lens.the image stabilization helped us take amazing pictures with the lens
customer_reviews.text: This lens was totally worth the money. We used it on our trip to cancun mexico. We tried buying it from other places during thanksgiving. But only Amazon offerd this lens for $100 cheaper than all the places we looked. The image stabilization on the camera lets you take amazing pictures at high resolution and zoom. We used it with our Canon rebel SLR. We already had a 20-55mm lens and needed another lens with more zoom. Overall totally worth the money. The only down side was we had to keep changing lens everytime we switched from taking pictures of far off objects to near-by object. But that is because we had two different lenses.
customer_reviews.author: Supreme shopper

customer_reviews.title: Dependable quality zoom lens for the Rebel XSi
customer_reviews.text: It's a good lens. The len's is made of plastic and feels like it. I've read some technical analysis on this lens which I won't repeat here, but in a nut-shell at greater zoom distances, the lens does loose a little crispness. Part of it I think has to do with the narrower barrel of the lens which is dictated by the type of mount it is built for. There's a bunch of reviews out there in the internet that can give the analytics and such. The quality is fine and I have not had any problems with it.
customer_reviews.author: J. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Great Lens for Price!
customer_reviews.text: I recently used the Canon EF-S 22-250 mm lens and I like the lens, as it is lightweight and takes great pictures. I used the image stabilization for handheld shots and I was well pleased with the outcome and quality of the pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Walter

customer_reviews.title: Great lens at a low cost!
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this lens is perfect. I'm not a professional but I do have a lot of experience in photography as a hobby. The lens focus motor is very quite, the auto focus is very fast, even indoors and the images are very crisp and clea. The lens is all plastic making it very light and easy to carry around. This lens is probably not suited for a professional photographer, but if you're a hobbyist like me, it's awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Philossifer

customer_reviews.title: Must have telephoto for APS-C DSLRs
customer_reviews.text: For below $100, this is a must have lens. It is adequately sharp when stopped down to f/8 across the zoom range. From personal usage, I tend to get the sharpest image around 140-180mm. I would get a Canon EF 70-300mm f/4.5-5.6L IS USM, but that lens is significantly more expensive. This one does the job well enough.
customer_reviews.author: A. Haikal Ruslan

customer_reviews.title: Favorite lens to date!
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite lens thus far! I was not able to get such amazing macro photos until this purchase and, my goodness, this was well worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Meghan Blackwell

customer_reviews.title: Cannon EF-S 55-250mm Zoom
customer_reviews.text: This was a used lens and I was a little hesitant about purchasing it. I am very glad that I did purchase the lens. The seller was very helpful in getting the lens to me in time for my daughters birthday party. I have some wonderful pictures now to treasure later. The packaging was excellent and I would do business again with them without any hesitation. Wonderful friendly seller. I am a novice picture taker, I don't qualify to be called a photographer. There were other lenses that went from 70 - 300 mm but did not have image stabilization. This lens does have image stabilization, which for me is a must.
customer_reviews.author: J. Dunston

customer_reviews.title: Great lens for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for the upcoming solar eclipse. Great lens for the price. Doesn't have the STM focus 'bells and whistles' of newer models, but for the purposes of being able to manually focus without having the camera powered on, I prefer these types of lenses.
customer_reviews.author: A. Nonymous

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Value Lens
customer_reviews.text: I didn't give this lens a 5-star rating based simply on performance, but on total value (performance + cost). It is at or near the top of the value heap as compared to any other lens I've owned or read about (and I've owned a bunch). I use it mostly for shooting sports in daylight. It focuses quickly, zooms smoothly and captures nice, sharp shots. I've used Canon 70-200 L lenses that cost 5 X as much with very similar results. This lens is also nice in that it is relatively small and unobtrusive for a zoom that stretches to 250mm. That might not matter to everyone, but it can be a plus.
customer_reviews.author: Lucky44

customer_reviews.title: Very nice lens
customer_reviews.text: This lens is great. Been using it for some time now with very impressive results. Colors and saturation are amazing, clarity is perfect. I honestly don't see the advantage of spending $1000+ on a L series lens when looking through pics taken with this lens and an L series lens leaves me not knowing the difference between the two... The AF is also quite fast and accurate. Nice lightweight lens that is pretty compact in size and takes awesome pictures. I read reviews before purchasing to find people commenting on washed out colors... I'm just not seeing it. If the pictures had anymore color they'd be well over-saturated. This may be just my experience, but this lens is highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Lilfurbal

customer_reviews.title: Great lens, fast and accurate focus, plenty of bokeh, not enough reach for wildlife and sport close-ups, and little distortion.
customer_reviews.text: Great lens. My favorite for portraits. Many people recommend the 50mm f1.8 as a first lens purchase but in my opinion this will give you far better returns. F/4-6 will give you plenty of bokeh if that is what you are after. Also the focus is much more accurate than other lenses I have used including the 50mm. This lens really won't give you enough reach for close-up wild life photography or the other side of the field in sports photography. What it is good at is event's, portraits, etc. It is great for getting right in on your subjects face.
customer_reviews.author: C

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Images & Great Price!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great lens for my Canon Digital Rebel! I am not a professional photographer in any way. I enjoy taking photos and primarily use my camera in my work as a real estate broker. I am very impressed with the quality of the images. Here are a few of my first pictures with it. I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Boesh7678

customer_reviews.title: This is an EFS lens not an EF.
customer_reviews.text: The description of this lens says it’s an EF lens, when in reality it is an EFS lens. It did not fit my Canon 6D since my camera does not support EFS lenses. Maybe I should have read the description more closely but it would be helpful if the title specified this difference.
customer_reviews.author: Isela Guerrero

customer_reviews.title: Very reasonably priced
customer_reviews.text: I've had this lens before (used), but passed it along to a friend and replaced with a new one ordered from Amazon. For me it was a no-brainer to replace with the same lens as it is very capable and very reasonably priced. It would never be mistaken for L-glass from Canon, it does a very good job and I find it very versatile at the 55-250 range. It picks right up from my 18-55 on my older Canon 40D, which is my back up camera. I'm pretty certain the camera's sensor could get more from better glass, but for everyday photography I think this lens is easily a winner.
customer_reviews.author: forkboy1965

customer_reviews.title: It's a Canon
customer_reviews.text: The design of any lens is to place specially-ground glass discs in the right configuration in front of the sensor/film and hold them there. Expensive lenses use durable materials to do that; cheap lenses use cheap materials. This is a relatively cheap lens. For the price, it does what it's supposed to do. For how long and under what conditions is anybody's guess. If I don't slam it around I'm hoping that it will continue to perform until I can afford L-series lenses. For now, I'm happy with my cheapie. Pros: lightweight, Image Stabilization and, like I said, it's a Canon. Cons: One word, Benjamin... plastic. See posted image.
customer_reviews.author: kate

customer_reviews.title: a good zoom lens
customer_reviews.text: got the bundle which included the standard lens so invested in this. images are clear and lens is steady, easy to change out, a nice feel to it. great photos. i do recommend a lens bag (which i have from the old days) to store it in inside the camera bag if you do not have super specialized compartments. a uv filter to protect the lens surface is a must. they are cheap so get a couple to protect your lens. a lens hood is also good. a rigid might be better for the zoom than the collapse-able rubber kind. get a cap keeper and always keep your rear cap!
customer_reviews.author: Ritas Mom

customer_reviews.title: Great durable addition
customer_reviews.text: This lens has been a great. I highly suggest it for beginning photographers. I had borrowed my friends EF 70-300 and I loved the zoom on my new camera. the only problem was my hands would sometimes shake because I would be hiking and tired. So I found this lens and have loved it since day one. the image stabilizer is a must for me. it helps so much to not have to worry about quality of the shot when the lighting is not good enough to take a high speed shot. It also makes my camera more complete with the 18-55 and the 55-250. Great color quality and focus.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Gadbaugh

customer_reviews.title: Lot of Image Stabilization noise...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this item as a replacement for my recent camera bundle for T3i. Initially I thought that my first telephoto zoom lens is having some issues as it was creating lot of sound when Image stabilization is ON. Then I ordered a replacement, but this time too the new lens is also having IS noise. Then I returned back this new lens to Amazon so that I don't wrongly take any new item without actually having an issue. My Old lens is still with me and is making lot of noise when IS is switched ON. But the image quality it takes is one of the best. But still not that happy with the Image stabilization sounds.
customer_reviews.author: Renjith R Pillai

customer_reviews.title: Canon always a winner!
customer_reviews.text: I sold my 75-300 mm non IS lens through Amazon and purchased this 55-250 IS lens as a replacement. This lens is a great complement to the stock 18-55 lend that came with my T2i. I do a lot of landscape photos and this lens really comes in handy. The pictures are always superior. Sports scenes like taking shots of grandkids are no brainers as this lens gets you right into the action. I like the feel and performance of this model and would recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: D. Pavese

customer_reviews.title: I find the zoom lens easy to use & the focal length is just right ...
customer_reviews.text: I find the zoom lens easy to use & the focal length is just right for quick shots with distant & close subjects. The image stabilizer & auto focus is a plus for 250mm at max zoom. I would buy the same type lens in the future if required. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: M.E.Demaree

customer_reviews.title: very pleased with the lens for the price I paid
customer_reviews.text: very pleased with the lens for the price I paid. Nothing super special, but the 55-250 range is very usable for a lot of scenarios. I do railroad photography and the lens does a pretty good job grabbing the moving trains and stopping them in the frame. AF seems to be a little off at times, but that could be my camera body itself. Currently using this lens on my Canon Rebel T3.
customer_reviews.author: C. Hommel

customer_reviews.title: My new favorite
customer_reviews.text: My favorite lens. I was concerned that the quality would decrease the further I zoomed, but that did not happen. I love this lens so much!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Can't take pictures without this
customer_reviews.text: I am what I call a hobby photographer. I do not have any special skills or equipment. Whatever I have learnt is self taught. This lens has been instrumental in my photography and has improved the quality of my photographs. This is of course in lay man terms..I have no idea about professional photography.
customer_reviews.author: deejay

customer_reviews.title: It is a good quality lens especially for the price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my wife for Christmas and she loves it. It is a good quality lens especially for the price. We had been priced out of a long lens for years, despite wanting one. This is one nice thing about having an older camera (Digital Rebel XT, purchased in 2007), the accessories come down in price along with the camera. While this lens may not be top of the line, professional grade, it works well for us taking nice crisp photos with that beautiful look you can only get from a long lens, especially good for portrait photography.
customer_reviews.author: Luke

customer_reviews.title: Great lens for most photoshoots and subjects
customer_reviews.text: This lens is a perfect size to take pictures of a certain subject, such as a person, with that perfect blurred background. It’s not too small like a 18-55mm but not as big as a 70-300mm lens. Just the Right amout. What I dont like though is how my lens made a little whirring sound when the stableizer was doing it’s thing. It still happens but I’ve gotten used to it and you really have to be in a quest place to hear it. Could just be mine though.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Corpus

customer_reviews.title: Great lens at price point
customer_reviews.text: It just arrived today so I took some quick photos at 250 to check out the quality. Great quality. Of course I am sure there will be a learning curve as there is with every lens, but a product test shows great potential for a zoom in this price range. I recommend for beginner photography at it's price point. Some people have mentioned the plastic body. I just want to mention that the body feels very solid. I don't shoot often with auto focus, I normally shoot manual settings and manual focus, but I tried auto focus and auto settings for some shots and they were good.
customer_reviews.author: christopher

customer_reviews.title: Perfect sync to my Canon t6i
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used it extensively yet but I LOVE this lens already and may use it more than my 135mm lens...perfect match to my Canon t6i and it actually auto focuses better than my 135mm...might be my regular lens now
customer_reviews.author: b06efj

customer_reviews.title: Terrific buy in discontinued lenses
customer_reviews.text: The shots taken with this lens are beautifully focused. I had to turn off the auto focus unless I'm composing a shot. While carrying the camera around via a strap on my neck, the lens kept trying to focus on random points ahead of me. My advice - you should buy this. Mine wasn't refurbished and was in the OEM box unopened.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Pic quality better than I expected... great lens for price... but makes me appreciate USM on other lenses.
customer_reviews.text: I gave this four stars because I think its a great lens for the price... but I shoot a fair amount in relatively low light and the auto focus is weaker than what I'm used to. Most of what I shoot is through a EF-S 17-55mm f/2.8 IS USM... So that's my point of reference. I'm happy with the images that I'm getting... But what I miss with this lens is focus in low light. This lens has more difficulty focusing in low light (even with a 580EX flash mounted!!) than the USM lenses do. At this price point I still think it's a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: T. Nolte

customer_reviews.title: Great price for a great lens. Beats other prices hands down
customer_reviews.text: Works beautifully and smooth. Everything worked like it’s supposed to. The quality of pictures are remarkable and something you can’t get with the standard lens.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: for having the item for several months it works great on my Canon T3i
customer_reviews.text: Now, for having the item for several months it works great on my Canon T3i. The seller also did a great job packaging it. The Lens came with its original box with the instructions. The Seller also included lens hoods and UV filter, all of this with sufficient packing and labeling. I gave the seller five stars. However, give the product in general four stars because even though the lens is pretty good and the seller(who I would buy from again) was excellent, this current version of the Canon EF-S 55-250mm f/4.0-5.6 IS II is not as noiseless as its successor, the Canon EF-S 55-250mm F4-5.6 IS STM, which is almost completely silent.
customer_reviews.author: Digital Age

customer_reviews.title: Awesome item for the price
customer_reviews.text: I have only "tried" it once but the true trial will be at my grand daughter's volleyball games in a few weeks. That's what I purchased it for was her sports events where I need to get up close and personal! It cam well packaged and protected, arrived BEFORE the scheduled date. This is not my first purchase from Ted's electronics and so far so good with everything! Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Gail Walker

customer_reviews.title: Awesome budget telephoto lens!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first telephoto lens for my Rebel T3 and I have to say I'm quite impressed for the price I paid. If you can pick up this lens refurbished or used you will have a very nice sharp telephoto lens at a very low cost. Of course there are better telephoto lenses out there, but the for the price this one can't be beat. I have not had any issues with lens creep but one issue I did hear about when researching this one is that there may be some vignetting at 250mm. All that aside I would definitely recommend this lens to someone starting out who needs a telephoto lens to compliment the 18-55mm kit lens.
customer_reviews.author: Jared B. Schwager

customer_reviews.title: It's a OK if you're going on vacation.
customer_reviews.text: This lens is ok if you're going on vacation and you're mostly going to be shooting during the day. This lens doesn't do well in low light. If you're a semi-serious photographer, you should not play with this lens because it's just a telephoto kit lens. You might wanna go for something with a constant f2.8 aperture. Yes they're more expensive but remember that you only buy good glass once and they last longer than bodies (considering you don't smash your lens against a wall).
customer_reviews.author: Drig Raven

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Anything beyond point and shoot photography is new to me, so I can't speak about specs. I bought this lens before heading to Uganda and am EXTREMELY glad I did. I got lots of amazing photos that I would never been able to take with my off the shelf lens that came with the camera.
customer_reviews.author: this old house

customer_reviews.title: This has been a nice little lens for my first upgrade from the kit ...
customer_reviews.text: This has been a nice little lens for my first upgrade from the kit lens. The focus is sharp throughout the field of view. The telephoto adjustment could be a little smother but it's not bad. It auto focuses a little slow but again not bad for a low cost lens. Manual focus is smooth. I take mostly landscape and wildlife photos so the maximum aperture of 4.0 may not give you the fine background blur of a portrait lens. Whether you are a beginner or an intermediate photographer I think you will be happy with this lens.
customer_reviews.author: DeWitt

customer_reviews.title: The lens works well for an inexpensive zoom lens. ...
customer_reviews.text: The lens works well for an inexpensive zoom lens. I've used it to zoom in on the grand-kids, animals, and scenery. Mine is a little noisier when it is adjusting than an identical lens owned by a family member. His is silent, but with mine, I can hear the motor/gears when I preview the shot if the ambient noise is low. This does not appear to have any effect on the quality of the picture.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Very nice lens on my Canon T3i. I really like the auto focus even if it is a little slower. I took this lens to Glacier park and got some really nice shots of the mountains and surrounding area. I would call myself an extreme amateur and so I apologize for the lack of an in-depth review, but for someone who goes camping and hiking a lot, and wanted more zoom and versatility with my camera, this is working great!
customer_reviews.author: Yarrow10

customer_reviews.title: Bought this as a gift and it was perfect. The original ended up in pieces after falling ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift and it was perfect. The original ended up in pieces after falling on it and this was a perfect replacement. Still a great product, even if it is discontinued.
customer_reviews.author: Nyet Diem

customer_reviews.title: Great lens
customer_reviews.text: Great lens. I use it for my sons soccer games. Picture clarity was nice and the zoom was exactly what i needed to get the shots of him in goal.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen

customer_reviews.title: Telephoto On The Cheap
customer_reviews.text: If you're looking for a relatively inexpensive telephoto lens that gets the job done well then the Canon EF-S 55-250mm f/4.0-5.6 IS Telephoto Lens is what you're looking for. Easy to use, light enough that you won't mind carrying it around in your camera bag this lens works well for those times when you want / need a telephoto lens. My only complaint, and this is towards Canon themselves and not the lens, is that Canon doesn't provide a hood with the lens; Canon must realy think highly of their hoods as they are ridiculously expensive as an accessory. I bought a nice Hoya hood for this lens at about 25% the cost of the Canon hood.
customer_reviews.author: Les M. Bateman

customer_reviews.title: Awesome quality zoom lens!
customer_reviews.text: I love this lens. The auto focus and image stabilization work like a charm. The focus itself isn't too loud. Quieter than the nifty fifty, but louder than the 40mm pancake lens. The zoom is superbly smooth as well. I have the 18-55mm lens and it's very sticky. The 55-250mm lens is like night and day compared to the 18-55mm. Image quality is great and it isn't all that expensive. For it being in a plastic housing it has enough heft to it that it doesn't feel cheap at all. Great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Steven Puckitt

customer_reviews.title: Very nice lens!
customer_reviews.text: I'm very happy with this lens! Even at the longest extension, the pictures are clear. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: Great for pictures, mediocre for video
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because it was on sale if you bought it at the same time as the camera body. It is great for photography, when you have time to set your shot, however, when using the autofocus with video, 2 problems arose: the microphone on the camera will pick up the sound of the lens focusing, and when it focused, it would do it in little jumps, which is very noticeable on film. Summary: Great for photography, but if you are going to shoot video, either get used to using manual focus or get a different lens...
customer_reviews.author: Joel Cornett

customer_reviews.title: A great lens
customer_reviews.text: I am an amateur photographer, it's a hobby for me. I received this lens a few days ago and am very impressed with the quality. I read some reviews that said it makes loud noises but I haven't experienced that. The only sound I have heard is when it focuses and it really isn't loud, just a quick fzzt. The zoom wheel is smooth throughout the zoom range. I took a few pics to assess the quality of the photos and am impressed. I don't think you can go wrong with this lens.
customer_reviews.author: Harley

customer_reviews.title: Still testing.
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had a chance to field test this lens, but it does great for zoom, portrait and product photos indoors.
customer_reviews.author: Black Light Org

customer_reviews.title: As expected
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because the 18mm-55mm lens that came with the Canon EOS T5 Rebel I bought doesn't have a strong enough zoom to meet all of my photography needs. This 55mm-250mm has much better zoom capabilities than my other lens and it was in excellent condition when I received it. This lens should give me many years of telephoto shooting satisfaction.
customer_reviews.author: Casey W. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Nice upgrade for my older Rebel T2i
customer_reviews.text: Arrived super fast! Seems to work fine. Good complement to the 18-55 stock lens the camera came with. This will replace my older Tamron zoom which didn't have IS and therefore always left me wanting more crispness in the photos.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Hoover

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product for birdwatching
customer_reviews.text: I really liked how I can now take clearer images of the birds around my house and other things farther away. When trying to take pictures of my friend the lens wasn’t the best in my opinion for portrait photography. It did do a good job with farther distance and focusing on one thing. So if you are wanting landscape this may not be the lens for you or portraits.
customer_reviews.author: Daphne

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to the camera
customer_reviews.text: Needed that lens that was in between the standard and zoom. This gives me both options without having to change lenses. Great quality for my Canon Camera
customer_reviews.author: Gregory A. Hoggatt

customer_reviews.title: A fantastic purchase
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to buy a “used” lens but with the Amazon 30-day return, I played the odds and won! This lens is in perfect working order. It came envelopes in bubble wrap and air cushions as well as double boxed. There was no damage, cosmetic or otherwise. 100% satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Tonya Randall

customer_reviews.title: Good Lens for outdoors
customer_reviews.text: This is a good lens, has performed flossily. I would suggest however if you are a vacation photographer where you may have a close shot followed by a far shot to spend the extra and get the Canon EF-S 18-200MM and then the . The 50 at the long range dose not make up for what you loose in the close up on the 55-250. Examples are on a boat or just walking around moving in and out of tourist sites, you are always fiddling with changing this lens to get back to something that gives you a wider angle.
customer_reviews.author: J. Weaver

customer_reviews.title: Awesome transaction and price!
customer_reviews.text: Great price for a fantastic lens! The image stabilization is awesome, as I have arthritis and sometimes I shake. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Deanne Chapman

customer_reviews.title: Works great, inexpensive!
customer_reviews.text: This in-expensive lens worked perfect for our trip to Sedona. I’m just an amateur photographer that needed an upgrade so I can’t complain. The pictures were to our liking!
customer_reviews.author: dice6

customer_reviews.title: Good lens, good price
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item used and it is in great shape. It came securely packaged and well wrapped. No signs of wear, everything moves smoothly, my Cannon EOS 77D was fully compatible. I haven’t played with it too much so I’m not sure about picture quality yet.
customer_reviews.author: jenifer grant

customer_reviews.title: Better Than Expected
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this lens with the Canon T1i. Amazon had an instant $200 reabate on the lens if purchased with the camera. This was a great deal and I use this lens more than the 18 55mm kit lens which is also a good lens. I would purchase this lens even at full price. The photos I've taken with it are very sharp and the focus is very fast in day light and good indoors. If you can't afford the EF zoom lenses this is a great alternative. The image stablization works well and allows for sharp pictures in low light at shutter speeds as slow as 1/30 second.
customer_reviews.author: Mike in STL

customer_reviews.title: Well Priced, but --
customer_reviews.text: This lens is well priced, but suffers from being quite soft and has some minor design issues. First, I don't think anyone could really expect this to be tack sharp at this price level, but it's not terrible either. As always though, you get what you pay for. Second, if you buy the lens hood with it, you'll find that it's difficult to remove the lens cover with it on. It's a minor complaint, but you'll need to work around it. **Heads Up** I bought this lens for roughly $180. Currently they're charging a bit more than that, but someone else on Amazon is selling the newer IS II version for a lesser price. Search for that instead. ;)
customer_reviews.author: Nicolas Reveles

customer_reviews.title: The camera lens was great. I used it the same day I received ...
customer_reviews.text: The camera lens was great. I used it the same day I received it. It was in great shape, worked perfectly, and was well worth the cost. PHYSICAL GEOLOGY was in poor shape when it arrived. It had been heavily and hard used. For what I paid, it is a questionable expense. The rating given in describing it was not accurate. GEOLOGY: A COMPLETE INTRODUCTION and HISTORICAL GEOLOGY were in great shape and well worth the costs. They exceeded my hopes.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph Pifer

customer_reviews.title: Great lens
customer_reviews.text: I recently bought this lens from amazon when it was on sale for like $ 205. Its a great price for a lens as the local department stores sells the same lense for 299 plus tax. Anyways I love this lens for its build quality, its give you amazing pictures, almost 8x zoom which is awesome. My only complain is the Image stabilizer, It works fine and all, however its a bit noisy when the shutter button is pressed halfway down. It kinda makes a small electic motor (buzz) noise, It is annoying but hey, that doesnt affect your pictures at all, So i guess i can live with it. :)
customer_reviews.author: Nash

product_meta.title: Canon EF-S 55-250mm f/4.0-5.6 IS II Telephoto Zoom Lens
product_meta.description:
Style:Base| Product Packaging:Standard PackagingFROM THE MANUFACTURER
Incorporating Canon's Optical Image Stabilizer technology, this Canon 55-250mm telephoto zoom lens captures long distance, low-light shots far better than many comparable lenses, helping you photograph the far-off action of athletes or zoom in for an intimate portrait with a blurred background. The high-zoom-ratio lens is equivalent to a focal length of 88-400mm in the 35mm format (when used on Canon EOS cameras compatible with EF-S lenses). More significantly, the image stabilizer effect creates an equivalent shutter speed of roughly four stops faster than the same size lens without an image stabilizer. In other words, if the slowest shutter speed you can hold a 250mm lens steadily is normally 1/250th of a second, this Canon lens will let you hand-hold shutter speeds as slow as 1/15th of a second. The lens also boasts a UD-glass lens element to correct chromatic aberration to create excellent image quality throughout the zoom range. Delivering an excellent performance at an affordable price for all photographers, the 55-250mm lens carries a one-year warranty. 

 Specifications


 * Focal length: 55-250mm 
 * Maximum aperture: f/4 to f/5.6 
 * Lens construction: 12 elements in 10 groups, including one UD-glass element 
 * Diagonal angle of view: 27 degrees (at 50 feet) to 6 degrees (at 15 feet), with APS-C image sensors 
 * Focus adjustment: DC motor, gear-driven (front focusing design) 
 * Closest focusing distance: 3.6 feet (0.31x maximum close-up magnification) 
 * Filter size: 58mm 
 * Dimensions: 2.8 inches in diameter and 4.3 inches long 
 * Weight: 13.8 ounces 
 * Warranty: 1 year 

This telephoto zoom lens is designed with Canon's Optical Image Stabilizer technology while retaining compactness and lightness, in response to demands of photographers. This high zoom ratio lens is equivalent to a focal length of 88-400mm in the 35mm format (when used on Canon EOS cameras compatible with EF-S lenses), and the image stabilizer effect equivalent to a shutter speed about 4 stops faster than the same size lens without Image Stabilizer. In other words, if the slowest shutter speed you could formerly hold a 250mm lens steadily was 1/250th of a second, with Canon's 4-stop stabilization correction, you could hand-hold at shutter speeds as slow as 1/15th of a second. It also uses a UD-glass lens element to correct chromatic aberration for excellent image quality throughout the zoom range. This new EF-S telephoto lens with great features delivers excellent performance at an affordable price for all photographers.
feature_bullets: Optics: 12 elements in 10 groups, UD glass element
Canon EF-S Mount (not compatible with full sensor DSLRs)

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars2,473 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
